alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 27 at 3:37AM MST until December 29 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations generally ranging between 6 and 10 inches above 7,500 feet with locally higher amounts of 1 to 2 feet possible in the Tusas mountains above 10,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Chuska Mountains, Far Northwest Highlands, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...From this evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to snow packed roads and poor visibility. Some roads may be closed, and significant travel delays are possible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
